DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Diagnosis Progressive Disease Post Standard Treatment Or No Standard Treatment Exists Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to the patient's diagnosis of cancer that is increasing in scope or severity after standard of care treatment for the disease, or for which no standard of care treatment for the disease exists.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cancer Diagnosis Progressive Disease Post Standard Treatment Or Negation Standard Treatment Be Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: General term for detecting and classifying cancer in patients._A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._A therapy approved by a health regulatory authority and in wide use, which is considered to be the standard of care for the management of a specific disease or condition._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._A therapy approved by a health regulatory authority and in wide use, which is considered to be the standard of care for the management of a specific disease or condition._The state or fact of existing at a place and time._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: General term for detecting and classifying cancer in patients. (from CSP94)

Concepts.definition: General term for detecting and classifying cancer in patients.

Property.preferredName: Progressive Disease Post Standard Treatment Or Negation Standard Treatment Be Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.:Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:A therapy approved by a health regulatory authority and in wide use, which is considered to be the standard of care for the management of a specific disease or condition.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A therapy approved by a health regulatory authority and in wide use, which is considered to be the standard of care for the management of a specific disease or condition.:The state or fact of existing at a place and time.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
A therapy approved by a health regulatory authority and in wide use, which is considered to be the standard of care for the management of a specific disease or condition.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A therapy approved by a health regulatory authority and in wide use, which is considered to be the standard of care for the management of a specific disease or condition.
The state or fact of existing at a place and time.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient been diagnosed wi
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been diagnosed with cholangiocarcinoma or other solid malignant tumor that has progressed despite standard therapy, or for which no effective standard therapy exists?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is registered to the Phase 2 portion of the study, does patient have a histologically confirmed metastatic or locally advanced unresectable cholangiocarcinoma/gallbladder carcinoma that has progressed on at least 1 prior standard of care therapy or for which no acceptable standard of care therapy exists, or in which the patient declines standard of care therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been diagnosed with a solid malignant tumor (other than cholangiocarcinoma or primary CNS tumor) that has progressed despite standard therapy, or for which no effective standard therapy exists?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically documented advanced or metastatic solid tumors which have progressed after at least one line of therapy OR, if no standard therapy exists, patients with histologically documented metastatic solid tumors who have not undergone prior treatment, OR patients with lymphoma who have refused or do not have remaining curative options (e.g., transplant)?
